content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Definitely not 5m but indeed solveable

took me 20 minutes because i swaped x&y .
i'm used to coordinates in codinggames are y,x :)
My Solution : https://pastebin.com/fgvNfXGd

It's not specified if beacons can be placed outside a map. If they can then there is no test to check that.
It's not specified if there can be two beacons in one position. It'll not change much but maybe it'll be relevant for some solutions?

In the input:
> "Line 1: Two integers, w and h, the height and width of the required output"
I propose using "map" instead of "required output." You should avoid using different terms for the same thing.
> "Remaining Lines:"
Change it to "Next n lines:".
> "somewhere to the east or west, but not north or south..."
If you gonna use a system cardinal directions you need to specify that in the output map North is up etc. I recommend not using them at all and saying "to the right", "above" etc
Challenging and not something seen already.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool to solve. But it might take more than 5 mins.

Nice and very cool problem. But yes generally it might take longer than 5 mins or even 10 mins. Here is my implementation.
https://pastebin.com/8JRfyXjC

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nobody else has commented. I still find this challenge solid and creative. If there is no opposition on difficulty I want to approve.

I enjoyed this one, took me about 11 minutes. Might be a little difficult? I really liked your test cases! You caught when i overwrote an O with a dash. The approve button says the puzzle is to be solved in 5 minutes.

It took me 2 minutes to grasp the task at hand. In the description I would add something to the effect of a beacon emits light vertically in a column with '|'. And horizontally in a row with '-'. Every time the beams cross place a '+'.
